main event: A disk-shaped amber-colored object was sighted over Dayton, Ohio on March 24, 1963.
interesting points: The object was estimated to have a 50-foot diameter and moved at a high rate of speed to the east.
The object was observed for 15 minutes at a steady rate of speed.
The report indicates the object was evaluated as a 'ball of fire, probably a meteor, possibly a satellite, unidentified'.
The observer was asked to estimate the speed and distance of the object, but there is no indication those estimates were provided.
The observer was asked about weather conditions, previous sightings, and their opinion on what the object was, but these details are not included in the report.
